stem: After injury near the medial epicondyle, a patient shows radial deviation when attempting wrist flexion. Which nerve/muscle involvement best explains this?

choices.D: Ulnar nerve — loss of interossei only

rationale_correct: Ulnar lesion at elbow denervates FCU, leaving FCR unopposed and pulling the wrist radially during flexion.

rationale_distractors.A: Median loss of FCR would bias toward ulnar deviation, not radial.
rationale_distractors.C: ECRB is an extensor; the finding concerns flexion direction.
rationale_distractors.D: Interossei loss affects finger ab-/adduction, not wrist flexion vector.
rationale_distractors.E: Axillary nerve deficits affect shoulder abduction.

evidence.citation: Selski D. Nerve Injuries of the Upper Limb (Slides). 2022.
